image.altText: A drone photo of a small ramp, with clear seas and lush greenery. The sky is blue.

props.synopsis: Marion Scrymgour has revealed the Northern Territory government and Commonwealth are a "long way" from resolving a funding dispute over the controversial Middle Arm industrial precinct outside of Darwin.

title.children: Federal MP casts doubt over future of billion-dollar Middle Arm project

image.altText: White cattle on red dirt stares at the camera with blue sky and low dry shrub in the background.

props.synopsis: Northern Australia's cattle industry is once again battling the government at the Federal Court, seeking compensation that reflects its losses from the export ban.

title.children: Cattle industry back in court chasing final payout for live export ban

image.altText: A drone photo overlooking the Tanami mine, you can see a big pit with infrastructure in the background.

props.synopsis: One of the country's most remote mines is getting a billion-dollar upgrade, taking gold production deeper into the Tanami Desert as gold prices hit record highs.

title.children: Australia's remote desert mine plans for 40 more golden years

image.altText: Man wearing Christian cross necklace

props.synopsis: Darwin's Catholic bishop writes to the Northern Territory government expressing concern over a chronic lack of access to NT prisons, saying chaplains are effectively being locked out.

title.children: Chaplains locked out of NT jails as prison population reaches record high

image.altText: Willie Rioli holding a footy on field with other players

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide player Willie Rioli posted to social media to explain his "hatred" of the Hawks stems from his family's historical relationship with the club.

title.children: Willie Rioli's 'hatred' of Hawthorn outlined in deleted social media post

image.altText: A scarred red desert landscape

props.synopsis: Award-winning Alice Springs cinematographer Chris Tangey's world-first wildlife drone film will be among the works showcased at the World Expo 2025 in Osaka.

title.children: Alice Springs filmmaker takes historic drone epic to the World Expo

image.altText: A man looks through prison bars.

props.synopsis: To survive the Syrian prison known as the "human slaughterhouse", Moaz had to live a lie. Then it got real.

title.children: Moaz thought his son's words had condenmed him to death. He was wrong

image.altText: The sun rises above a highway. The sky is coloured red and yellow.

props.synopsis: Young Australians are most at risk, according to new research by the University of Adelaide.

title.children: 'Only going to get worse': Extreme heat linked to rise in mental health disorders

image.altText: Child playing with differnt colour balls of play dough on table before him. Face not visible

props.synopsis: Thousands of documents released by the NSW education department show a lack of knowledge by childcare providers about the laws that are designed to protect children in their charge.

title.children: 'High risk' childcare provider took test four times before running centre

image.altText: A smiling man in a hat and sunglasses sits on a boat.

props.synopsis: Brett Williams had "2.1 million reasons" not to kill Craig Dunn on the day the sale of his property was to be finalised, when the tenant who made his life a living hell would finally be out of his life.

title.children: Inside the bitter dispute that led to a landlord killing his tenant

image.altText: a woman in a factory with boxes and a bag

props.synopsis: From toy brands to fashion labels, some Australian firms are facing tariffs way above the 10 per cent "baseline". Company owners say they are not getting enough support as they navigate soaring tariffs to send Chinese-made goods into the US.

title.children: The Australian companies facing China-sized tariffs on US imports

image.altText: A composite image of two women, one Liah Yoo

props.synopsis: American beauty founders are warning prices are likely to go up as the global skincare and cosmetics industry comes to terms with Donald Trump's new tariff regime.

title.children: 'Hurts me so much': How Trump caused chaos in the K-beauty world

image.altText: Uncle Carey wearing a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: A large majority of Aboriginal community-owned health facilities in Victoria are in urgent need of infrastructure funding, according to a new report from the state's top advisory body and peak body for Indigenous health.

title.children: Indigenous elders say crumbling health facilities are fracturing community

image.altText: A man with dyed blonde hair with black roots in a white collared shirt stands outside near a tall glass apartment building.

props.synopsis: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they are struggling more than ever with housing costs.

title.children: Voters unhappy negative gearing, stamp duty not on horizon this election

image.altText: A woman in a blazer and a pearl necklace

props.synopsis: Independents Monique Ryan and David Pocock say content made by social media creators paid for by politicians should be disclosed.

title.children: Monique Ryan says paid influencer posts must be disclosed after awkward on-air moment

image.altText: Two young children reach for sandwiches, grapes and carrots from colourful lunch boxes at school.

props.synopsis: Greens leader Adam Bandt will spend his week in Queensland, seeking to sandbag the party's three seats of Griffith, Ryan and Brisbane and announcing the Greens would push to establish an $11.6 billion free school lunches program in the next term of parliament.

title.children: Greens in week-long 'retain Brisbane bender' with free school lunch pledge

image.altText: A black labrador sits next to a woman in a green top who is laughing.

props.synopsis: Researchers are looking for overweight golden retrievers and labradors to take part in a study on dog health.

title.children: Overweight labradors helping research obesity impact on dogs

image.altText: Two men wearing suits and ties looking slightly disgruntled.

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers and Angus Taylor have clashed over housing policy during a heated debate about Australia's economy on 7.30.

title.children: 'Such a crisis': Housing debate erupts live on 7.30

image.altText: woman holding her dog while on the phone

props.synopsis: We look at your obligations when it comes to calling in sick, including what to say and what evidence you may need.

title.children: How to call in sick and what evidence you need

image.altText: A group of women wearing blue suits

props.synopsis: The pop star, alongside other celebrities, joined Jeff Bezo's fiancée in the first all-female flight in more than six decades.

title.children: Popstar Katy Perry blasts into space on Blue Origin rocket flight

image.altText: Male and female police officers carrying backpacks and bags exit a home and walk down stairs at night time.

props.synopsis: Local police officers arrived at a home in Ambarvale to find a 65-year-old woman had sustained a gunshot wound to her leg.

title.children: 65yo woman shot dead in drive-by shooting in Sydney's south-west

image.altText: Ukrainian emergency officer walking on a charred roadway alongside a burnt-out car shell, destroyed trees and a blue building

props.synopsis: Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy has invited US President Donald Trump to visit Ukraine to witness the devastation from the attacks in Sumy first-hand.

title.children: Zelenskyy urges Trump to visit Ukraine as Russia accused of 'war crime' in Sumy

image.altText: A woman in a white blazer sits next to a man in a navy suit

props.synopsis: Housing ministers face-off on Q+A after big-spending pledges for first home buyers in campaign launches on Sunday.

title.children: Housing ministers face off on Q+A on key voting issue

image.altText: A composite image of two posters of Zoe Daniel and Tim Wilson.

props.synopsis: Across the historically conservative stronghold of Goldstein, voters are tuning in for a federal election rematch between the Liberals and the teals. These are some of the issues on their minds.

title.children: In Melbourne's bayside suburbs, a teal-Liberal rematch is underway

image.altText: Josh Shapiro in a navy jacket speaking at a wooden lectern in front of police officers

props.synopsis: A suspected arsonist has been charged with attempted homicide, terrorism and aggravated arson, accused of setting fire to the home of Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro.

title.children: Man charged with attempted murder and terrorism after US governor's home targeted in fire

image.altText: For sale sign in front of apartment building

props.synopsis: New housing policies likely to increase house prices due to surging demand from first home buyers.

title.children: Voters and economists united against major party housing policy promises

image.altText: a male politician wearing a suit waving at a lectern

props.synopsis: The housing debate ramps up, a Coalition senator makes a Trumpian sartorial choice and (most) former prime ministers turn out to help their parties.

title.children: Former PMs turn out, senator has MAGA moment and housing debate heats up

image.altText: a nsw police van next to the water during the search for a driver in the parramatta river

props.synopsis: Police divers have recovered the body of an 86-year-old man after he drove his car into the Parramatta River, hitting his elderly wife while she was standing on the riverbank.

title.children: Police recover man's body from Parramatta River after car plunged into water

image.altText: Rory McIlroy holds his head as the crowd celebrates behind him

props.synopsis: Rory McIlroy has finally achieved golfing immortality in a modern masterpiece of sporting theatre, its flawed brilliance so relatable and so wonderfully symbolic of the Northern Irishman's career as a whole.

title.children: One of sport's greatest final-day battles ends with McIlroy's name in lights

image.altText: A micro chip seen on a circuit board

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says new levies on semiconductor imports into the US will be announced in the coming week, with their "national security" impacts to be investigated.

title.children: Trump to impose new chip tariffs, including on electronics exempted days ago

image.altText: A yellow box which reads "Glad Wrap" in red

props.synopsis: The manufacturer of GLAD waste disposal and food storage bags, hit with $8.25 million federal penalty for making incorrect product recycling claims.

title.children: Clorox fined $8.25m over misleading 'ocean plastic' claims on GLAD bags

image.altText: Cyclist Melissa Hoskins smiles during an interview.

props.synopsis: The mother of former Olympic cyclist Melissa Hoskins has told an Adelaide court she accepts her daughter's death was a "tragic accident".

title.children: Mother of Melissa Hoskins says Olympian's death was a 'tragic accident'

image.altText: A person rides a motorbike with dust behind them as a white helicopter flies and follows nearby.,

props.synopsis: Some competitors are thousands of dollars out of pocket after the Gascoyne Dash in regional WA was cancelled, which organisers blame on the hospital being full.

title.children: Last-minute cancellation of desert racing event leaves riders furious

image.altText: two men facing one another on a dark background one is red and one is blue

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton are vying for your vote. Here’s what sets them apart.

title.children: What sets two of Australia's most powerful men apart from each other
